did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Dwight Sanderson papers, 1894-1960, 1894-1943 (bulk)
did.physdesc: Diaries, bibliographies, manuscripts, student papers, correspondence, publications, a scrapbook, photograph albums, and class materials.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes 43 annual diaries of appointments; bibliographies; student papers; correspondence; papers on the family, marriage, and other topics; lecture outlines for classes on rural sociology, social psychology, and sociology; publications by Sanderson; scrapbook of articles following his retirement; post retirement letters; a photocopied excerpt from A Brief History of Entomology at the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas concerning Sanderson and Glenn W. Herrick (1960); five albums of photographs and postcards from European travels, 1925/1926 and 1935; and other materials pertaining to Sanderson's work in rural sociology and related fields. Also, letter from Pearl Buck, written from Nanking, China, July 6, 1930.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of rural sociology, New York State College of Agriculture at Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes 43 annual diaries of appointments; bibliographies; student papers; correspondence; papers on the family, marriage, and other topics; lecture outlines for classes on rural sociology, social psychology, and sociology; publications by Sanderson; scrapbook of articles following his retirement; post retirement letters; a photocopied excerpt from A Brief History of Entomology at the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas concerning Sanderson and Glenn W. Herrick (1960); five albums of photographs and postcards from European travels, 1925/1926 and 1935; and other materials pertaining to Sanderson's work in rural sociology and related fields. Also, letter from Pearl Buck, written from Nanking, China, July 6, 1930.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture.Dept. of Rural Sociology.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Dwight Sanderson papers, #21-33-73. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Four Years of County Planning & Development (mimeographed copy)
A Demonstration in County Development (3 bound copies)
Tompkins County Schools (3 folders)
The Family

scopecontent.p: (All of the following are from Chapters I, VIII, XI, XII, XIII, XIV; Chapters XV, XVI, XVII, XXI were noted in collection as missing)

did.unittitle: Physiology and Psychology of Petting, Legal Aspects of Betrothal
The Prediction of Adjustment in Marriage
Husband-Wife Relations in Marriage
Family Bibliography
Extracts from Thomas-Tusser's Book on Huswifery" (edition of 1580).
Federal Extension Service (Boy's and Girl's Club Work)
FERA (Federal Emergency Relief Admin. )
Group I & II
Rural Organization 16 Lecture Outlines, Notes
Rural Organization Miscellanea
Rural Secondary Schools, Social Studies
Rural Sociology I-IV
Social Psychology
Sociology 15 (Introductory)
"State Departments of Agriculture " by Dwight Sanderson. Written at University of Chicago in 1916.
Annual Cornell School for Missionaries
"Moral Education in the Public Schools"
Philosophy 31 (Paper presented at University of Chicago)
Psychology (Abnormal) Paper,, and Sociology Paper prepared by D. Sanders on at University of Chicago
"A Psychological Account of the Program of Religion" - Paper given at University of Chicago
Rural Community I -VI I I
Rural Community, No. VIII-XI
"Rural Community Organization for Religious Education" -Rural Church Seminar
Problems of Rural Democracy
Rural Organization, No. l-III
Memorandum concerning Proposed objects of the American Farm Bureau Federation (Prepared and circulated privately at the time of the first meeting of the American Farm Bureau Federation in Chicago. )
Rural Organization - IV-IX
Association Press (National Council of the YMCA)
County Agents Course
Depression Problems, I-II (much correspondence in preparation of Sanderson's manuscript on "New Problems of Rural Youth )
The Family. Chapters I through VIII. Chapters 14, 15, 16, 17 & 21 are missing.
Factual Material for the Discussion of "Trends in American Standards of Living" by L.S. Cottrell
The Group III
Leadership I-IV (Farm Bureau, Scrapbook, Leadership, Letters & Bibliographies, student papers . Includes a mimeo copy of "Rural Leadership" by D. Sanderson
Miscellaneous correspondence re E.D. Sanderson. Also, various awards and articles.
Miscellaneous Pictures (mostly negatives) and Postcards.

Diaries; correspondence concerning publication of Sanderson's works, such as "The Farmer and his Community," "Elementary Entomology", "Insect Pests of Farm, Garden and Orchard", and job opportunities around the country.
All illustrations and photographs used in books by D. Sanderson
Entomological Publications
New Hampshire Entomology
"Report of the West Virginia Agricultural Experiment station"
The Rural Community
Rural Sociology and Rural Social Organization
All the above are by D. Sanderson
Texas Entomology
"Report of the West Virginia Agricultural Experiment Station"
"Report of the State Board of Regents, West Virginia"
First Biennial Report, State Crop Pest Commission, West Virginia
Report of the New York State Food Supply Commission
The American Journal of Sociology, pp. 117-260
Rural Sociology, Vol. II, No. 1
Volume Report: "The Contribution of Extension Methods, and Techniques Toward the Rehabilitation of War Torn Countries"
Scrapbook of early works
Scrapbook of early themes and copies of the Hesperian Star from the Agricultural College in Michigan.
NYS Food Supply Commission. Preliminary Report of the Census of the Agricultural Resources of New York State. Bulletin No. 2
Bulletin of the NYS Food Supply Commission. Report of the Conference.

Articles, letters re retirement, and letters of condolence to the Sanderson Family, including a black binder of newspaper obituaries. Also two reprints: A Biography of Ezra Dwight Sanderson by W.A. Anderson, and a bibliography of Sanderson up to Sept. 25, 1943.
Brief biographical sketches of Sanderson and Glenn W. Herrick, publ. 1960, 8 pp. photocopy.
Letter from Pearl S. Buck.
"The Family in the Life of Today", Handbook for leaders of discussion groups.
"With Love and Affection, Respectfully Yours, Graduate Students". (A bound collection of laudatory letters from graduate students to D. Sanderson upon his retirement.
One bound volume of early work (including high school themes) by D. Sanderson.
One scrapbook of school material and grades through college; including various souvenir programs and invitations.
One student notebook on Entomology with hand drawn insect examples.
One scrapbook of insect photographs and newspaper clippings.
One scrapbook of newspaper clippings re: the Tompkins County Development Association.
Two folders: Contents of a scrapbook of clippings and printed items.
Album containing postcards and photographs

scopecontent.p: Locations include France and one in Germany, including Amance, Amiens, Avignon, Bar-le-Duc, Bazancourt, Bellefosse, Bormes, Buire-sur-L'Ancre, Chalons-sur-Marne, Chanteheux, Courtisols, Einville, Fouday, Fressin, Le Treport, Giens, Ribaud, Givry-en-Argonne, Hangest-en-Santerre, Hyeres, La Ferte-Chevresis, Laon, Le Havre, Lyon, Metz, Motteville, Nancy, Paris, Reims, Ribemont, Rilly-la-Montagne, Rouen, Rouffach, Salins-des-Pesquiers, Seichamps, Sezanne, Solbach, Strasbourg, Tronville-en-Barrois, Vertus, Vitry-le-Francois, Witry-les-Reims, and Schwarzwald.

did.unittitle: Album containing postcards and photographs

scopecontent.p: Locations include France, including Aix-en-Provence, Alps, Arles, Auray, Barjoles, Bordeaux, Camaret, Carnac, Chateaulin, Cite de Carcassone, Correns, Crozon, Damazan, Draguignan, Gardanne, Grimaldi, Guillaumes, L’Aveyron, La Feuillee, La Haute-Garrone, La Rochelle, Landivisiau, Marseille, Menton, Merville, Monaco, Monte-Carlo, Montmeyan, Montpellier, Morlaix, Nerac, Nice, Nimes, Puch, Quimper, Quinson, Rennes, Roscoff, Saint-Malo, Saint-Pol-de-Leon, Sanremo, Sospel, Tonneins, Toulouse, Vianne, and Villefranche.

did.unittitle: Album containing postcards and photographs

scopecontent.p: Locations include France and Italy, including Amboise, Bernay, Blois, Chambord, Chemonceaux, Courtonne-la-Meurdrac, Grand-Champs, La Bretagne, Laval, Le Mans, Lisieux, Loches, Locmariaquer, Marolles, Sologne, Thiberville, Tours, Vannes, and Florence, Genoa, Milan, Rome, and Venice.

did.unittitle: Album containing postcards and photographs

scopecontent.p: Locations include Switzerland, Germany, the Czech Republic, Poland, Denmark, the Netherlands, Belgium, including Bern, Lucerne, Romanshorn, Zurich, Berlin, Dresden, Leipzig, Munich, Potsdam, Cesky Brod, Olomouc, Warsaw, Liskow, Aaskov, Copenhagen, Frederiksborg, Haraldsborg, Kronborg, Odense, Roskilde, Svogerslev, Vejen, Amsterdam, Groningen, Volendam, Wageningen, Winschoten, Brussels, and Leuven.

did.unittitle: Album containing postcards and photographs

scopecontent.p: Locations include Belgium, England, Scotland, France, Italy, Germany, and the Netherlands, including Diksmuide, Ypres, Bruges, Brussels, London, Warwik, Oxford, Grasmere, Durham, Lincoln, Ely, Cambridge, Alloway, Trossachs, Glasgow, Edinburgh, Paris, Tours, Rome, Milan, Berlin, and Amsterdam.

did.unittitle: Album containing postcards and photographs

scopecontent.p: Locations include Italy, Croatia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Greece, Bulgaria, Romania, including Trieste, Gradiste, Mraclin, Nova Gradiska, Tomasica, Zagreb, Kovacevac, Orasje, Veria,Lovech, Cismigiu, and Bucharest.

did.unittitle: Album containing postcards and photograph

scopecontent.p: Locations include Ireland, Scotland, Wales, England, France, Luxembourg, the former Yugoslavia, Monaco, Switzerland, Germany, and Belgium, including Cashel, Connemara, Foxford, Galway, Kilkenny, Killarney, Larne, Limerick, Londonderry, Sligo, Tipperary, Abbottsford, Aberfeldy, Alloway, Dunfermline, Edinburgh, Fortingall, Glen Coe, Inverness, Loch Lomond, Aberystwyth, Carnarvon, Canterbury, Kenilworth, Aubenas, Blois, Briancon, Eze, Nimes, Paris, Puget-Théniers, Rueil-Malmaison, Sion, Versailles, Diekirch, Brig, Gletsch, Lucerne, Bingen, Heidelberg, Herrenalb, Murg, Offenburg, Worms, and Brussels.

did.unittitle: Diplomas from the University of Michigan, BS 1897; Cornell University, BS 1898; University of Chicago, Ph.D 1921; and certificates from Phi Kappa Phi, the Department of State for the 12th Congress of the International Institute of Sociology, Ministry of Agriculture of Belgium, and the Country of Luxembourg
